Reviews.Title: “Hotel Galleria”
Reviews.Author: mboyd71
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I recently stayed at the Hotel Galleria on our first trip to Venice, and I can only hope to get a room there every time I travel to Venice from this point forward. It was fabulous. The hotel itself is charming. It is decorated with beautiful antiques and Murano glass chandeliers. Many of the rooms have a lovely view of the Grand Hotel and the Academia Bridge. They serve a delicious breakfast in the room, but best of all, the staff is awesome. Mr. Luciano welcomed us to Venice by recommending one of the best cichetti restaurants on that side of town. He and his business partner consistently recommended excellent dining establishments, interesting places to sight see, and provided us with friendly and helpful directions along with maps. When I broke my arm at the end of the stay Mr. Luciano even made a trip to the local Farmacia for me. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to have a wonderful Venice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Responding to a few reviewers who have had problems with bookings.”
Reviews.Author: Dawn-Katrina
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 4 times in this charming hotel and enjoyed it so much I booked it as a present for my brother and sister in law, or at least I thought I had booked it. I was in email correspondence with the hotel and sent through my details to confirm the booking. As the date came nearer and I realised I had not received confirmation I rang the hotel who had no record of my booking and were by now full. I was very disappointed, however the hotel staff could not have been more helpful, they were very apologetic (even though it may or may not have been them who were at fault) and sourced other accomodation for me. A nice apartment near St Marks square. Mistakes happen and they did all they could to rectify the problem for me. I have found that if the website does not give the information required and/or if email contact breaks down it is very effective to ring the hotel directly. I have never spoken to anyone who could not speak English and all staff have been very helpful, so please do not let technology put you off this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in awesome location”
Reviews.Author: VaterZeit
Reviews.Content: We knew beforehand Hotel Galleria was a very small hotel with limited facilities. However, the location is unbeatable, just two steps away from Ponte della Accademia and overlooking the Canal Grande. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. There is a fridge with complimentary drinks for the guests. I see some of the rooms are very tiny but ours (Room no. 10) was huge, with two big windows overlooking the bridge and the Canal. The room was spotless and full of history, with antique furniture and paintings. En-suite bathroom was small but clean and functional. Breakfast is served in the room. It is delightful. You may think it is expensive when you book it, but the place is really nice and there's no cheap way to have views overlooking the Canal. Will definitely come back (as soon as possible!)

Reviews.Title: “The Grande Canal out your window”
Reviews.Author: rmartin1125
Reviews.Content: This beautifully placed hotel is on the Grande Canal next to the Academia Bridge. Location is perfect. Within a few yards of the Vaparetto Academia stop. Breakfast served in your room. Beautiful furnishings. Opt for the larger rooms as the smaller ones can be tight.

Reviews.Title: “Location, grand view, lovely owners”
Reviews.Author: Dale C
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with a PERFECT location just off the Accademia bridge. Rich decor, lovely fabrics. Owner and staff warm helpful and welcoming. the view from our room was dreamy. a few "blocks" from the Peggy Guggenheim Museum, the neighborhood was such a respite from the San Marco bustle. great cafes and restaurants on this side of the canal. One minor potential drawback, the walls are quite thin- our neighbors were relatively quiet but you may want to bring earplugs for a perfect nights sleep. a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Katiek347
Reviews.Content: This location was wonderful with great views of the Grand Canal, easy access to water taxis and the Accademia Bridge. Our room was quite small w/ a shared bathroom, but we were on a tight budget! It looked like some of the other rooms offered were roomier with private baths. Even so, our stay was very nice and an excellent breakfast was served to our room each morning!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: GJMFlorida
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel on the Grand Canal! We stayed in the room in the front with the "cresant" shaped window overlooking the beautiful Grand Canal. Location is fantastic with breakfast delivered to your room. Wifi in main lobby. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Beedibells
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel Galleria. We had such a warm welcome from Stefano and Luciano who looked after us beautifully during our visit.The perfect location right on the Grand Canal with wonderful views from our room. We happily watched Venice come to life every morning while having a delicious breakfast in our room. The hotel is situated right next to the Academia vaporetto stop which makes it ideal for transport. It is also well situated for many good restaurants in walking distance in the Dorsoduro district. We will certainly be back, as well as recommending it to friends going to Venice. Really good value. Thank you Stefano and Luciano for such a special place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Gene P
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Hotel Galleria 5 times now, it's so wonderful! Can't beat the price for a room on the Grand Canal, would cost 2 or 3 times as much anywhere else. They also throw in a free trip in a water taxi to Murano, very special. The hosts, Stefano & Luciano, and all the employe's are great. They've helped us with all our questions on what to see and do and how to get around. Really got spoiled by them bringing us our breakfast on a silver tray in our room at whatever time we wanted (wish I could get that at home). The rooms with views on the Grand Canal, and even the rooms looking out at the Accademia Bridge, are fabulous. Room #10 is the biggest and grandest with beautiful antique furniture, venetian wallpaper, and a painted ceiling. I finally realized why we go to Venice so often, staying at this hotel is what makes it so special and why we keep going back. Great location, easy access to everywhere. The Vaporetto stops right in front of the hotel and the Alilaguna boat from the airport stops a few minutes away. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms are nice others too small”
Reviews.Author: Slam60
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice staff. Stayed here Oct 10. Had big room 10 for a couple of nights which was nice, but then had to move next door to room 9 for a few nights. Room 9 was so small you can touch both walls with arms outstretched. We chose to leave at that point and find alternative hotel. Breakfast served to room at prearranged time can be inconvenient if you want to sleep in a bit. Hotel is OK If you really need to be right next to the Academia Bridge and if you can get one of the 2 large rooms 8 or 10, otherwise there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Worst nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: yyhh
Reviews.Content: I tried to book this hotel on July 7, 2011 for a stay in early October. However, while I got immediate response to confirm the availability of the room, once I sent out my credit card information to confirm the booking, I have never heard back from them again, even though I tried to contact them a couple of times. Naturally, I thought my email didn't get through to them and booked another hotel. However, when I came back from my Italian trip, I found I was charged for the hotel room which was never confirmed! I tried to contact the hotel first, and again no response whatsoever. Then I had to file a dispute via my credit card company. However, they magically showed to the credit card company a confirmation email that I have never received! Now I have to write another lengthy letter to dispute the charge. I would not recommend this place to anyone! I have done a lot of traveling over the years. This place is probably my worst nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Great hosts, great location”
Reviews.Author: HaulAss
Reviews.Content: We had the best room (no.8) where we were served breakfast every morning in our room overlooking Academia Bridge and the Grand Canal. Read the rest of the reviews for intimate details, but we thought (apart from the beds which were very soft) that this place was astounding for location and value - plus Luciano and Stefano are super helpful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect locale on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Toomey66
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s really hard to beat the Galleria for a great location in Venice. Just steps from the Accademia Bridge, and not in the heavily touristy San Marco area, this quiet little hotel was a lovely respite from the heavy throngs of people. The room that we stayed in (number 10) was very clean and with its wallpaper and furnishings, it almost felt like we were in an exhibit in one of the museums we visited. Iâ€™ve read a complaint that the noise from the Accademia vaporetto stop can be annoying late at night, but with the windows closed, it is not bad at all. Another selling point is that The Galleria is just a short trip from any part of the city and you can get anywhere from there (by vaporetto or on foot) in a very short period of time. We were in Venice for just three days for our 10th Anniversary, and this lovely little hotel was perfect for our needs. Breakfast was served promptly at our requested time and always with a smile and gracious â€œBuon Giornoâ€�. Many thanks to Luciano, Stefano and their wonderful staff for making our special time that much more special.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Wildoh
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the hosts incredibly welcoming and helpful. The one draw back were the rooms were noisy - at night you could hear every word next door or when people walk down the corridor to the bathroom - but that's reflected in the price and the star rating.so shouldn't be a surprise. I would have no trouble starting again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun, Good Views, Gracious Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: FriarTuckSherwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for its location and reasonable (for Venice) price. It was great fun. Management had warned that the only room facing the Grand Canal was small. How true! But what a view and what endless entertainment. Reception was gracious. So too was service. Fellow guests were themselves entertaining. It all had the ambience of a sort of private club in and old residence (which it is, come to think of it). Transportation is easy by vaporetto, on foot or Alle Laguna. We hope to return (and ask for a bigger room).

Reviews.Title: “Really a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: MarcZicree
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, with a view of the Academia Bridge over the Grand Canal out our roomâ€™s window. Lovely breakfast served right in our room. Very romantic, with a helpful staff of Luciano and Stefano who spoke English. Also not in the thick of the tourists but amongst the native population, great walking the narrow byways day or evening, and convenient to the water taxi. Highly recommended. The only caveats are that due to the foot traffic on the bridge it can get noisy late at night, and also mosquitos can be a problem (the windows have no screens), so you might want to bring repellant or ask the staff. Otherwise, simply wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great views of the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Boze4Ever
Reviews.Content: We had a lot of luggage & the hotel was situated very close to the Academia ferry stop, this was a major plus, as we saw other tourists dragging their luggage signicant distances from the ferry stops to get to their accomodation, so keep this one in mind. The views from our room were great, we opened our windows wide & we were right on the Grand canal. The hussle & bussle of the canal traffic dies away by nightime, so noise was not a issue when sleeping. The room was smallish, functional & kept to the local venetian style. We enjoyed the look & feel of the room. WiFi is available, however you need to access this from the lobby area. A good plus is cold drinks sucj as water & soft drink are available to guests for free, perfect as you grab a few cold drinks for the days exploration. We enjoyed our stay here & for the price were pleasantly surprised with our accomodation experience

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Customer Service and Location on Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: burnsey223
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with another couple stayed at this hotel in April 2011. The best thing that we remember about this hotel is the awesome customer service. We were planning on leaving very early the next day and the gentleman at the front desk went out of his way to make sure that we got breakfast. He was very friendly and prepared our breakfast for us to have before we left the next day. The lady that was there was also very helpful with giving us directions around the city. Our room was right off the Grand Canal. We had an awesome view of the canal and Academy bridge from our window. The room was nice. Too bad we were only in Venice for one night. If we ever get a chance to go back, I would love to stay at the same hotel again. Thank you for the great service.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay years ago, recommended to countless people and no reply to emails asking to honor posted price.”
Reviews.Author: Jane517
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay in room number 10 on our honeymoon. It was 2006 though the "when did you travel" does not go back that far. As a surprise for him I planned a return trip for the first week of December 2011. I had been watching the website for several months and noticed that the prices for December remained consistent. I booked the round trip tickets, arranged my work schedule accordingly and emailed the hotel. The response indicated the rooms were not the price on the website but were now higher and completely out of my price range. I inquired twice as to whether they would honor the price. Whereas in the past my emails were answered within hours, neither of these two were ever returned. In the second email I inquired as to a suggestion of somewhere else to stay should they be unable to honor the price posted on the day i requested the room. No reply again. Really makes me sad. I have recommended this hotel to countless friends, family, clients for 6 years and I can't even get a polite "no" we cannot honor the price on the site. Simply no response. As a business owner I can't comprehend the lack of respect or appreciation this lack of response conveys. Two days later I'm still searching for something comparable and in my price range. A sweet little hotel in a great location with beautiful views. Just DON'T BOOK IT BASED THE POSTED PRICES. EMAIL THEM FIRST. I have two tickets and no where to stay. Save yourself the heartbreak.

Reviews.Title: “Central”
Reviews.Author: GSather
Reviews.Content: Pros Includes a really large breakfast spread Location is excellent Staff is friendly Can leave luggage Secured door Free beverages Cons Location (due to vaporatto stop, traffic on the water, heavy foot traffic with drunk tourists at 3 am) Mosquitos or sweltering heat (i.e. no screens in the windows) Room size Here's the deal... none of the cons are the fault of the hotel. The staff was really helpful, the breakfast was excellent and consisted of croissants, yogurt, tea or coffee, rolls with spread... the view was indeed of the grand canal. The problem is that space in Venice is a premium. I talked with tourists that were paying over 400 euro for rooms that were not much larger than ours, and ours had a twin bed that barely had room to squeeze around. Yes, we also had a WC in the suite, but all in all the room couldn't have been more than 60 sq feet. We couldn't lay out our yoga mat in the extra space without having to put away all of our luggage. Also, although a view of the grand canal sure seems amazing, that romantic image stems from movies and wishful thinking from before motorized engines. What a complete terror! The hotel is a few meters from one of the Vaporetto stops (the 'bus stop' for the grand canal mass transit) and those things have LOUD engines and reverse the motor multiple times to slow the boat before CRASHING into the dock ... as late as 4 am and as early as 6. Finally, the hotel is right at the base of the Accademia bridge - one of the only ways to cross the grand canal, so the foot traffic is loud at all hours.... if you're lucky you won't have a drunk tourist (no onder poeple are so turned off my us americans) screaming at boats and other people at 3 am. If I return to Venice (which is a BIG 'if'), I will certainly stay off of a smaller side canal - and I'll make sure I can afford a room that's larger than a crypt.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Venice Experience”
Reviews.Author: auntronda
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small hotel on Grand Canal. Canal can be a bit noisy at night, but gives you the true Venetian experince. Owners very helpful and cordial. Easy location close to tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “We will return to Veneto!”
Reviews.Author: dwhite2011
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was fantastic- the two windows in our room gave us a nice cross breeze. Breakfast served to us in our room, by the windows, was also a nice touch.Hotel staff gave a great recommendation for dinner! ...what's NOT their fault: the Ferry stop outside, though nice to have, sounds like a garbage truck outside the window at night. But still worth the stay!

Reviews.Title: “True Venice experience”
Reviews.Author: Bellevuetraveler
Reviews.Content: Great location overlooking the Accademia bridge. We loved watching the parade of people and dogs right under our window. The downside of that, of course, is that it was noisy late at night. We sort of enjoyed that too though. Coming from the US, our sleep patterns were all messed up anyway. The noise didn't keep us up - it entertained us since we were already not sleeping. We stayed at this hotel for just one night prior to boarding a cruise ship. We had lots of luggage but the proprietors were very helpful about getting it up and down the stairs. The room was small for 3 of us but it would have been roomy without the extra bed. The bathroom was tiny but very clean and nice. Breakfast is served in the room. They brought in a tray with lots of very nice pastries, tea and cocoa (we were asked if we wanted tea, coffee, cocoa, yogurt...). It was hard to eat without making a mess and one of us had to stand up but it was a good breakfast. The ceiling in the room had a pretty European coved edge that made it all too clear that a much larger space had been partitioned into small rooms. That was sad but I know hotel owners in Venice are struggling. We chose this hotel because we were looking for a truely European experience before boarding the cruise ship. In that respect, the hotel did not disappoint! We probably would not stay here again only because the room was so small for the 3 of us and I believe they only have one triple room. For one night it was fine but for a longer stay it would be difficult.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: julia b
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple nights in Venice. We had a room on the corner with windows overlooking the Grand Canal and the Academy Bridge. The location was very convenient which was wonderful. The staff and hosts were very helpful. You have breakfast served in your room which is fun and good. Although there is a shared bathroom, we had no problems with availability. We also didn't have air conditioning, but our room was fine with the fan. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: am0123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was my absolute favorite. It was recommended to us by family who had stayed there years previous to us going and they had nothing but kind words to say about the hotel. It's a very small hotel run by a family which gives it so much character. The rooms on the canal are absolutely amazing. It gives you a real taste of Venice, and there's a really nice breeze at night. They have a fridge for you to take free drinks, and you can choose a time that you would like breakfast served to you on a silver tray. Most of the rooms do not have their own bathroom, however they do have a personal sink for you to use and a shared toilet and shower with the other 10 rooms. I never had to wait to use the bathroom and everybody was very considerate about keeping it clean and free. The hotel is located in a perfect spot, the hotel staff is so pleasant and accommodating, and it was such a good price for what you get. I would recommend this hotel to anybody staying in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “"Room With A View"”
Reviews.Author: speckle
Reviews.Content: I booked room 8 at the Hotel Galleria a year ago, as I wanted to make sure I would get to stay in that particular room after seeing previous traveler's photos taken sitting on the chairs looking out at the Grand Canal. After a whole year waiting, it was finally my turn to sit and enjoy the passing parade of boat traffic on the grand Canal. It was simply amazing and so entertaining, night and day. The owners and their staff were very welcoming and friendly, room eight is lovely, in addition to the canal facing window, the furnishings are very Venetian, the bed was the most comfortable of all our Italian accommodations and the breakfast, was by far the most tasty. The almond flavoured croissants were still warm as were the bread rolls. The breakfast came delivered to your room on a silver tray, complete with silver teapot, water and milk jug. We enjoyed this at a table by the open window watching the early morning vaporettos, and barges bringing in all the supplies that Venice needs to operate as a very busy tourist destination. Hotel Galleria is situated right beside the Accademia bridge and vaporetto stop, so it is very easy to find, plus you do not need to trundle luggage over bridges and down alleyways. This is a one star hotel, so you will not find an elevator, TV, phone, air con, bar fridge etc, but who needs these things when you are in the most amazing unique city! However you will find a ceiling fan in your room which is very efficient, a fridge in the hallway which is stocked with free bottled water and other canned drinks. A big Thank-You to Luciano, Stefano and all the staff at Hotel Galleria, for helping make our time in Venice so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful and gracious place to stay”
Reviews.Author: calvisitor_11
Reviews.Content: We were so amazed with the service and graciousness of the Hotel Galleria. Our room was very small, primarily because I had to revise our reservation late in the day. Yet, even with the small quarters, I loved the stay there. We had a window right on the Grand Canal. There are lovely extras that make a guest feel as though her every need is anticipated. I will choose this hotel for future visits. There was a great little restaurant right downstairs and a delightful morning breakfast served in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: somanyholidays
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Galleria for 3 nights as part of our recent trip to Italy. We booked easily through the hotel's website and found the owners to be very helpful when answering any questions we had. The Hotel is easily reached by the Vaparetto (taxi boat), just get off at the Academia stop and the hotel is right there on the left. We stayed in room 8 which was a double with an en-suite bathroom and lovely crescent shaped window that looked out onto the Grand Canal. We loved sitting in the window and watching the world go by! The room was plenty big enough for 2, there isn't AC but there is a ceiling fan and we found this sufficient. There is no fridge/mini bar in the room but there is a fridge in the hallway right outside room 8 that has diet coke, fanta and water all free for you to have! The owners and the night staff man were all very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is served in your room at what ever time you wish between 8 and 930. The breakfast included croissants, bread rolls, yoghurts, jams, tea, coffee, and juice. The hotel is in a fantastic location and within easy walking distance of everything. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: fredfrogAshevilleNC
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay at the Galleria was most pleasant. The hotel's accomodations give you a wide selection /combination from which to choose; our bathroom was in our room and other than being a bit cozy, was very adequate. The location is outstanding, the staff is very halpful and most anxious to please, and the breakfasts and other features make it a good value for the location . While the rooms are quiet, if you stay in numbers 2, 3 or 4 and the late night crowd (in the restaurant beneath your windows) is boisterous, the noise can be bothersome. The only criticism is that for a stay of three or more days, the clothes storage space is limited....at least it was in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views from our room of the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Mo6pack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Galleria for 2 nights while in Venice. We arrived by train and the hotel was very easy to get to on the Ferry Boats from the train station. We stayed in the front corner room closest to the Accademia Bridge, I believe it was room 5. We had two windows with beautiful views of the Grand Canal. But, they faced the bridge, so when the bridge is full of people you loose privacy if your windows are open. Since there is not air conditioning you need your windows open. There is also a ceiling fan, so we were not ever hot in the room. Our room did not have a private bathroom, we shared a bathroom with 2 other rooms and it was down the hall. It did not cause any problems, we only had to wait once for the bathroom to open to shower. Breakfast was delivered each morning at whatever time you choose, it was simple, but was very delicious and filling. The noise of the canal did not bother us, but we kept the windows closed at night. And we did not hear any noise from any of the other guests either and they were full both nights we were there. The hotel was a great value for it's location and everyone there was very helpful. Only thing that was an issue was that to get into the hotel you had to ring the doorbell to be let in and be given back your room key. Our first night we met people in an Irish Pub and stayed out much later than expected. We felt bad that we woke up the night worker to let us in so late.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: geerickson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Galleria for one night after a Mediterranean cruise. The hotel is located near the base of the Accademia Bridge, adjacent to a vaporetto stop, and served as a great base to conduct a walking tour of Venice. We had a corner room with two windows that offered a beautiful view of the bridge and the Grand Canal. The hotel was also just a few minutes walk from the Zattere stop across from Guidecca, where we boarded the Alilaguna water bus to Marco Polo airport for our flight home. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Experience”
Reviews.Author: Snuffytoo
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice, and we found Hotel Galleria in one of the guidebooks. What a lovely find! Because of our schedule, we had to change rooms, so we got a chance to see two. The first, room 9, was...a little small, barely wider than the bed. But it had a new (if small) private bathroom, a ceiling fan which made all the difference, and a wonderful view right on the Canal. The bed was very comfortable, the room was clean, and the furnishings charming. The second room, room 2, was not on the canal, but was much bigger, equally clean and comfortable. We were offered breakfast served in our room each day, but because we had no itinerary, we declined, simply because we didn't even want to plan 12 hours in advance! Thus I cannot comment on the breakfast, beyond its offer. The location of the hotel was absolutely excellent, the staff helpful and friendly, and the overall experince wonderful. A special shout-out to Stefano, who was so adorable. We'd definitely go back, even for a really, really small room!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, great staff, good value for location”
Reviews.Author: GlynCarre
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a number of times now. Location by Accedamia bridge is perfect. Staff are exceptionally helpful - for instance I was welcome to use their PC to check-in for my return flight. Cold drinks are provided free of charge, a nice touch. Single room (#6) is small however the view is amazing and the antique decor at the Galleria is lovely. Really, for â‚¬90 a night over a UK Bank Holiday Weekend this is good value for such a stunning location. An absolute winner!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love_to_Travel_60885
Reviews.Content: Hotel Galleria was wonderful. It was in a great location within walking distance to all of the sites of Venice. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a room with a private bathroom which was nice. Breakfast was served in your room so it was great to enjoy with my husband overlooking the Academia bridge. The rooms are smaller and it is an older building but well worth the price paid and excellent location. We LOVED Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here. Overpriced, very rude staff and not good for a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Shehla_Burney
Reviews.Content: I regret staying at this place. This is a very old building disguised of a charming hotel. But it is not. The floor is very old so every one can hear loud footsteps. Besides, you cannot have intimacy or privacy with your couple because the walls are very thin. The breakfast is small and they serve it in the room. 100 steps away there was another hotel with the same prices but it has a buffet breakfast and private bathroom. I paid the same price ($100 euros) and I did not get a private bathroom. I got a "view" to the channel, which was not good at all. The person at the counter was absolutely rude to me. He was so rude that I decided to leave the hotel before my check out date. If you want to know details, contact me please.

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: barbaram_2
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel Galleria and we were not sorry that we went back. The hotel is perfectly located at the foot of the Accademia Bridge. It is in a neighborhood with lots of restaurants and lots to see. The water taxi stops here as well. It is a small hotel and does not have a breakfast room, but breakfast comes on a silver tray to your room each morning. Stefano and Luciano are very helpful - as well as their staff. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck!”
Reviews.Author: Mavery003
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in an awesome location. Although the hotel itself is rather simple and the room was rather small, we had a great experience. The breakfast (included with room reservations and brought to your room every morning at a time of your choosing) was delicious and the staff was very helpful. I'd recommend this hotel to any active travelers who will spend most of the time out seeing the sights and will be using their hotel room mainly for sleeping!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel next to an easily identifiable bridge/landmark”
Reviews.Author: stubaby68
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. The font desk was always friendly and helpful. They also gave us a great local restaurant recommendation, which was much better than the food we found around the typical Venice hot spots. And they served us breakfast in the room each morning. The hotel is very accessible from the Accademia vaporetto stop, as long as the boat drivers aren't on strike. Even when walking, the accademia bridge was fairly easy to navigate to/around. The room was a little small, but we weren't expecting much since the building is so old. There was also some boat noise on the canal at night, but it's still much quieter compared to other cities we've stayed in. It was an easy trade off for having a window on the grand canal. The hotel was pretty quiet as well. We didn't really hear other guests while we were there. We would stay here again, if we were going back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: familylind
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights pre-cruise in October, 2010. (I am very late writing this review). We had the room with the crescent window, overlooking the canal. Eating breakfast in the alcove was a treat, especially being able to watch the Grand Canal come to life in the early morning. The little fridge with water and pop was a welcome touch. When we arrived, I was reading the book "City of Falling Angels", part of which takes place in Palazzo Barbaro. Imagine my surprise to find this palace directly across the canal! Breakfast was delicious, the staff were great, location near a vaporetto stop made sightseeing easy, all in all a perfect stay in a perfect little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: nitsi
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in a beautiful room with a view of the bridge/canal and it was one of the nicest rooms we stayed in and we were travelling for four weeks through Europe. Luciano and all staff were brilliant, lovely breakfast, clean rooms and so convenient to everything. I could not fault this beautiful homely B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous grand Canal hotel, very fair price!”
Reviews.Author: CadetheCorgi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the largest room with a crescent shaped window on the grand canal. Very nice views, It was not too noisy as some might think. the bed was comfortable. Breakfast delived promptly as a time you choose. We are going to stay in an apartment next may otherwise we would stay here again. Very nice location,

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Galleria was a wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: liz018
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in room 8 (with the crescent window). The view was fabulous and this room was a good size. There was some noise at night, which was fixed by closing the window if needed. However small price to pay for being so close to the Grand Canal and Accademia Bridge. Breakfast each morning was freshly baked, still warm croissants and a good choice of tea, coffee and juice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Great Location, Clean, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: 2intheWorld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here two nights in Sept. 2010. You can't beat the service or location for the price. While the the walls are thin just bring ear plugs if you think noise will be a problem for you. We stayed in room No. 5. Great view of canal and enjoyed having breakfast in room at our windows. If you are looking for 4-5 star hotel from an American standpoint, this isn't the place for you. If you are looking for a great value at a great price that's clean and in a wonderful location you can't beat Hotel Galleria. Having complementary soda and water bottles was a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay, customer service unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: channie50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at this hotel, which was one of many stops on our honeymoon. The rooms were beautiful and clean. Breakfast was included, which they serve in your room at your preferred time. They have fridges stocked with water and beverages, which you did not need to pay extra for. The customer service was absolutely amazing. Albert was exceptional, and went above and beyond explaining the city and informing us of the best places to visit. We would recommend this hotel to anyone, and would definately stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, good price, fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: WT45
Reviews.Content: We didn't need AC in Sept., and took a chance, staying in a room overlooking the Grand Canal at this delightful small hotel near the Accademia Bridge. We loved being in the Dosodura section, and highly recommend this charming spot..

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: fjcasey
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin with this hell-hole of a hotel. I don't know when the last time you stayed there was, or if you even ever have. But we were shocked, to say the least, when we were brought to our room. The woman who greeted us at the front desk was very kind, and the initial "quaintness" of the hotel lobby was fine. What was not fine? Everything else! This hotel should never be recommended. We were brought to the room (Number 1) right next to the front desk on the first floor just above the cafe on the street. She opened the window and turned on the ceiling fan...there was no air conditioning. There was no TV, no phone in the room, and with our bags in the room, there was no where to walk at all. When we looked up, the ceiling was filled with black cobwebs, that had obviously been there for a very long time. You couldn't sit on the toilet and shut the bathroom door and the bedspread was filthy and worn with holes. We were horrifed to say the least. I spent about 5 minutes in the room and promptly left Kurt there, sick, to go and look for another hotel. Fearful that they were all going to hundreds of euros 150 euros and such a dump, what were we going to have to pay??? Turns out that you can get a great 4-star hotel for 110 euros a night. And that is just what we did. When telling them how we felt about their hotel they insisted that we had to pay for our stay...we pay them for one night and promtly left.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Option In Venice”
Reviews.Author: hcorn
Reviews.Content: Venice is a relatively expensive place to stay, and proximity to the Grand Canal carries a price premium. In this context, Hotel Galleria represents very good value. We had a large Grand Canal facing room, and a smaller room with Canal views and both were immaculately kept and cleaned. Staff were helpful and friendly. This is an authentic Venetian building, and those expexting 5-star glitz would be misplaced, as the architecture both limits the floor-plan, but also adds an authenticity to your stay that a large hotel can't produce. The proximity to the Accademia bridge and Vaporetto station is convenient, but can be noisy at night if your windows are open. That said, noisy tourists were more obtrusive, and I slept well. If you are after a reasonably priced, well run and maintained small hotel in Venice, this is an excellent choice. I would certainly stay there again when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the Grand Canel”
Reviews.Author: penmick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our stay at the Hotel Galleria in Venice. It is a small hotel at the foot of the Accademia Bridge with a wonderful view of the Grand Canal.The location is great as it is close to St. Mark's square. We got one of the large rooms which was very nice. A continental breakfast was delivered to our room each morning. The weather was hot while we were there and the hotel does not have air conditioning but we did get a nice breeze through the windows. It was a bit noisy as there is a water bus stop at the Accademia Bridge and they pull in every 15 minutes or so from early morning until midnight. The staff was friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, and good value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: colin_read
Reviews.Content: The Galleria is right by the Accademia bridge. My room looked right onto the Grand Canal, and my friend's looked onto the bridge and part of the canal. The rooms were reasonably sized, and the staff were friendly. No A/C, so might be warm in August, and it can be noisy with the windown open. I would definitey stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Views”
Reviews.Author: jethers203
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Room 10 for 3 nights with my wife. The hotel has a great location on the Grand Canal and next to the Accedemia Bridge. Things we liked: Size of the room, antique furniture, shutters that kept noise and light out, and the complimentary cold drinks. Things we did not like: The bed was very uncomfortable, the room / hotel did not have A/C. The bed was a king size (2 twins pushed together) and was very springy. We flipped the mattress over which helped a little bit, but did not get a good nights sleep while there. Added to this, without A/C we would open the windows and it would be too loud to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Jesper3105
Reviews.Content: Great location just next to Vaporetto stop on the Canal Grande and right next to the Accademia bridge which leads to easy excess across the Canal Grande. My girlfriend and I spend 3 days and 2 nights in Venice and I was recommended the hotel from another hotel I tried to book initially and I was very happy with the recommendation. The hotel is small, personal and atmospheric with old style Venetian interior. We has a big double (nr. 8) with direct view to the Canal Grande and the Accademia Bridge and with nice bamboo chairs and a small table for great breakfast experience. This was how I wanted it just me and my girlfriend alone for breakfast looking out on the Canal Grande with its sights. Breakfast was served at the room punctually and just outside our room the hotel had a complementary minibar containing water and sodas for free. (such a small thing just adds so much value) Everything we wanted to do was within short walking reach with several vaporetto stops (besides Accademia, Zattere is less than 5 minutes on foot away making for easy access to Guidecca), San Marco just a short walk 10 minute walk away and my personal favorite the walks in the small street, squares and canals of Dorsudoro and San Polo beginning right outside the door. The staff was very nice and helpful with our questions and had good recommendations on eatering (my girlfriend still claims the gorgonzola and spice sausage pizza we got recommended was the best pizza she have eaten). We could leave bags at the hotel for the third day (we had a late flight-so we had a full extra day) and when we accidentally passed the hotel in the middle of the day, they let us use the toilets. If I have to point to any downsides I have to think hard. The only, but obvious, that comes to mind was the price. It was rather high, but that is Venice and if I have to be honest I do think the price is much more reasonable for such a good location in Venice than what most other hotels can offer. If I have to be really, really picky the reception staff recommended us to take line 15 to Burano whereas I wanted to take line LN. We made it with line 15 (after 2 changes and some waiting on a isolated island) but line LN would have been faster (we took it back), although it was far more crowded - so maybe the nice, less crowded but slower trip was what the receptionist had in his mind. If so I guess he deserves credit for trying to give us the prettiest and most comprehensive sightseeing trip of the two (and eliminate what ever slight irritation I may have had). The most importantly is if you are happy with what you got, and we were. I definitely would recommend the hotel especially to couples looking for a romantic breakaway. The breakfast in the room and the charming interior combined with excellent view and superb location does make out for a great holiday in this very lovely and romantic city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Annamaria2010
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Although we only stayed one night. I was impressed that the pop and bottled water was free for guests as I had spent quiet a few euros on both on our trip. The breakfast was room service. The only negative is that I had requested a triple room and when I arrived i was charged more and the hotel claimed I had requested a double. This hotel was our last night in Italy (20 days). Great view of the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, clean but small room, breakfast delivered to door”
Reviews.Author: laneypie
Reviews.Content: We had a VERY late (3 AM) check-in at the Hotel Galleria, which the owners were very kind to oblige. Our room was pretty clean, but the furniture was fairly old, and one of the mirrors was so damaged from being exposed to moisture in the bathroom that it was unusable - we had to use the one near our bed. The room was absolutely breathtaking, however, and was worth every penny. The location was also excellent, as it was right next to the Accademia bridge and a wonderful canal-side pizzeria. It was a 5 minute walk from St. Mark's square, and a 10 minute walk to the Rialto bridge. Throughout our stay, the staff was very accommodating, and delivered our breakfasts of choice to our door at a time we selected between 8 and 10 AM. Great value for a hotel with a wonderful view of Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, but...”
Reviews.Author: denbenSoCal
Reviews.Content: We had room 10, wonderful views through two windows!! Nice people! I really wanted to love this hotel. This was the hotel that I was so looking forward to, butâ€¦ I donâ€™t know if this is normal for Venice, since this was our first time there, but there was a floor drain in the bathroom that reeked!!! And it wasnâ€™t because the trap was dry â€¦. We told the clerk and she poured some stuff down the drain, it didnâ€™t work. They said that the water levels affect the drain problem. I eventually covered the drain with a plastic bag and wet towels, turned on the fan and left the door shut. It still stunk, if it was warmer we would have left the windows open, but it was cold outside. I know itâ€™s an old building with great views and prices, but sewage smell is something that canâ€™t be ignored. We were happy to check out early. If it didnâ€™t smell so bad, we could overlook the noise of the comings and goings of the boats from the nearby vaporetto stop even with the windows closed and the thin mattress on springs. I had such high hopes for this little hotel, booked it even though it wasnâ€™t close to all the sites we wanted to visit. I don't even know how to rate this one... Staff were nice, had great views, room was clean, except for the sewage smell ... Very sad that this little hotel didn't work out...

Reviews.Title: “Nice location right on canal, friendly staff, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: midwestNYC
Reviews.Content: We really liked Hotel Galleria. Although it is on the opposite side of the Grand Canal from where we spent most of our time, there is a bridge right in front of hotel and so it was very easy to walk to and from the hotel. This also makes it very easy to find when you first arrive (can walk right from Academia water bus stop). We had a corner room with views of the canal, which was great, although we found that the motor traffic on the canal was quite loud througout the night. The hotel had a lot of character and our room was a good size, by European standards.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We'd Hoped For”
Reviews.Author: ChristyM113
Reviews.Content: This review is very late but I have to write about what a lovely time we had at the Hotel Galleria in Venice. I chose Hotel Galleria after lots and lots of time reading reviews on Trip Advisor. We asked for and received Room 8, which had a lovely arched window that overlooked the Grand Canal. Every morning we sat in two lovely wicker chairs and enjoyed our breakfast while watching the traffic on the Grand Canal. Amazing! The hotel could not be more happily situated, right next to the Accademia Bridge and a vaporetto stop just a few feet away. The staff of the hotel were very helpful and attentive. The weather was not very good the first day and we appreciated the umbrellas which were available to guests! The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was more than adequate. We were amused that the floor wasn't quite level but sloped toward one end. I don't think you could find a better value than Hotel Galleria and wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GADR
Reviews.Content: We loved Venice and the Galleria added to the pleasure. Great location, clean, comfortable, excellent staff and, by Venetian standards, sensibly priced. If you want a canal-front room or one with ensuite book early but if you can't get one don't despair - you will be happy anyway! Rooms are small but OK. Double glazing minimises noise from the canal & the bridge. Unless you have a fixation on new/modern you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Dream come true”
Reviews.Author: canengscot
Reviews.Content: It has always been my dream to see Venice, so in September 2009, my husband and I celebrated my special birthday there. It was made even more special because of our stay at Hotel Galleria which is located on the Grand Canal. Our room (#10) was delightfully furnished and decorated in a truly Venetian style, and the windows, which opened onto the canal, gave us a wonderful view of the canal. The owners, Luciano and Stephano, and staff, were very helpful in every way and having breakfast served in our room was the icing on the cake. I look forward to returning to Venice in the future and would certainly stay again at Hotel Galleria, and would not hesitate in recommending it to other visitors Venice. Grazie, Luciano and Stephano, for making by birthday a truely memorable one and my dream come true. Judy and Alistair Gregor, Perth, Ontario, Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I was hoping for!”
Reviews.Author: Tuptim
Reviews.Content: I spent a whole weekend on the internet searching for the right hotel in Venice. I must have reviewed about 400! Hotel Galleria seemed to offer exactly what I was looking for - a central location, small number of rooms, elegant (not over done) decor, an affordable price - plus it was part of an old palace, which was appealing. It's facilities were limited (breakfast served in the room) and not all rooms had their own bathrooms. There were so many glowing reviews of the warm and accommodating hosts and staff - and of the hotel generally - that I decided that this was the place for our special holiday. We were returning to Venice for our 25th Wedding Anniversary, having Honeymooned here in 1984. So - I really hoped I'd made the right choice.... I couldn't have made a better decision! I booked their best room - Room 10 - which is huge, is decorated with antique furniture and has a fabulous stucco ceiling (and does have its own bathroom!). It has two sets of windows which look out over the Grand Canal - in one direction straight to the Accademia Bridge. Locations in Venice don't come much better than this! A delicious and ample breakfast was brought to us at a time of our choice - and there was plenty of room to comfortably sit and enjoy the meal in the room. And for the morning of our departure - at 5am - the gentleman manning the reception overnight kindly prepared thermos flasks and pre-packed food so that we wouldn't start our day hungry and thirsty. A mini bar in the corridor provided unlimited free still and sparkling water, as well as a variety of fizzy drinks. I have never come across such a provision anywhere else and it is a thoughtful touch that will always be remembered by guests, I am sure. Everyone at the hotel - owners Luciano and Stefano and all of their staff - were unfailingly helpful and friendly. They were on hand to recommend and book restaurants, look up weather forecasts, provide umbrellas and just generally add to the joy of being in Venice. Yes, I know I'm gushing here - but really - our stay at Hotel Galleria couldn't have been happier or better. From the occasional views I had of the other rooms, I would say they are mostly quite small, but I heard several other guests saying how happy they had been with their stay, so they are obviously satisfied. We will hopefully return to Venice again one day and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else but the Hotel Galleria.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Italy”
Reviews.Author: redwineandcheese
Reviews.Content: This was our favorite of all hotels and cities on our trip to Italy. The room was huge, the bathroom clean, the antique furniture nice, comfortable king bed, and the view out the two windows directly over the Grand Canal absolutely wonderful. The breakfast was perfect for us: coffee, hot milk, yogurt, O.J., fresh croisants and rolls. It was delivered to our room, which we loved. We ate watching the boat traffic on the canal. What could be better than that? There is also a newstand just outside for the International Herald Tribune. The afternoon sun reflected off the windows across the canal was lovely. We found a market (Billa) a couple blocks away that had a nice deli section. Lots of sliced meats and cheeses, freshly cooked artichokes, Tuscan beans with onions, breads, grilled chicken, etc. Also wines. We made a great picnic one day. We spent a lot of time walking the small streets, crossing the small canals, and stopping in the small piazza's in the area. Very convenient to have the vaporetto dock and bridge just outside the hotel. It had a small town feeling. The only thing we would change: the antique locks on the room doors were hard to open from the inside. We worried some about our ability to get out in case of fire. I would love to see these updated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room, people & service; absolutely perfect.”
Reviews.Author: tomszack
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth time in Italy and third in Venice, but first at the Galleria. The hotel is located diectly across the street from the Accademia; a location perfect for exploring all of Venice. If arriving by air, the Alilaguna stops at Zattere which is maybe a 2 minute walk across the Dorsoduro to the hotel's front door. Arriving or leaving by train or car, the Piazzale Roma and train station are no more than a ten minute walk away. Anyway, we were in room #8 with a crescent shaped window looking onto the Grand Canal and if one cranes his or her neck, Santa Maria della Salute comes into view at the Dorsoduro's tip. The view was beautiful, the room was well appointed with antique funriture, and the en suite bath and bed linens very clean. Breakfast was served promptly to the room and the croissant, yogurt, toasted rolls with assorted spreads, hot chocolate and coffee were very good indeed. The room rates seem very reasonable as well for what you get; location, breakfast & level of accomodation. We couldn't have enjoyed our stay more and look forward to returning to Venice and the Galleria.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, superbly located”
Reviews.Author: Europe_Lover57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here purely and simply because of the existing reviews and were delighted with every aspect. Lcoation, value, the room, the view, breakfast. Yes it is a little noisy but charming to see the kids going to school and the people in general enjoying the views from the Accademia Bridge. For such a brilliant location, a little noise is a small price to pay. We stayed in Room #2 with our own bathroom. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience of life on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: JG4SanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Each morning and evening we were able to see life unfold on the canal from our hotel window. We stayed in both room 10 and 8. Many of our best photos were taken from the room. The fireboat, mail boat, delivery barges, gondolas, rescue boat, water taxis, vaporettos, and other small boats passed by on their way to work. The church bells, gondola parties in the evenings, and the boatmen and gondoliers calling to each other were there each day. Luciano and Stefano helped us with maps to their favorite churches and painters in areas far off the beaten path. Palazzi Barbero is directly across the canal from the hotel. Henry James wrote the Aspern papers there, the Curtis family from the US lived there, and it was a location for Brideshead Revisited, all chronicled in the 'City of Falling Angels'. You can find fault with this hotel as any other, but bravo to Luciano and Stefano for providing a unique Venetian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: dontcallmeillcallyou
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 10. Very roomy, nice view of the canal and very convenient to the water taxi or walking to most of the attractions. I enjoyed breakfast in the room and they delivered right at your requested time. The front desk was very helpful with any questions we had.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing view, convenient location, noisy”
Reviews.Author: curtis_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 1 which was advertised at having a view of the Accademia Bridge and Canal. It has a great view of the bridge but to say it has a view of the canal would be a pretty big stretch. There is a pizzeria below (which is pretty good) but between the people traffic on the bridge and the pizzeria hours we didn't get much sleep. It probably would have been ok for younger people who stayed out later. The room is tiny, barely enough room for your luggage but that isen't unusual for europe. It had a private bathroom which was nice but you can hear the person working the desk and the tv until quite late. We did get a look at Room 5 which did look amazing. We did not feel that room #1 was value for the money we paid. Breakfast is ok and you can't argue that the location is great. It is a short walk to St. Marks Square and very convenient to the water bus so you don't have to drag your luggage very far.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price with amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoTraveler28
Reviews.Content: We were only in Venice for a few days and stayed at Hotel Galleria (room #5). The room was huge compared to most Italian accomodations. While it didn't have a private bathroom, it did have two windows. One opened toward the Accademia Bridge and the other straight onto the Grand Canal. For 135 Euro/night, we had breakfast delivered to our room each day. We ate it in front of our window and soaked in the view. One night we even got a bottle of wine and pizza and had dinner in. Who needs to go out with a view like this?! In addition, the hotel offers free soda and water in a mini fridge down the hallway (nice perk when small cans of soda are 2-3 Euro a piece). The owners were great and it was not a problem to share the bathroom. We had to wait a few times, but only for a few minutes. It was expected. There are nightly concerts in the church across the bridge. We saw a Vivaldi show and it was fantastic! And Galleria recommended a wonderful restaurant nearby. It was reasonably priced (hard to find in Venice) and the food/ambiance was great. Can't remember the name, but they have business cards for the restaurant. It's down an alley nearby. We truly felt like we found a hidden gem in Venice. Great price and location between St. Marks and Rialto. We found both of those areas too hectic and it was relaxing to come "home" to the Galleria. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for the cost”
Reviews.Author: billpall
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is situated just yards from the water taxi stop in Accademia so it is very easy to get to. That's the good news. The bad news is it sits right on the street where school kids taverse back and forth so if you want peace and quiet in the morning, try another place. A typical continenial breakfast is brought to your room and is ample to start the day. The staff is very helpful to make local recommendations. One of the best features of this hotel is they have a small mini bar in the hallway and its always stocked with cold water and soda for their guests (no charge). It's a small thing but it shows the care they have for their guests. Stefano and Luciano go out of their way to make you feel welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay with Unbeatable View”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Theopolis
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific little hotel in the wonderful Dorsoduro district of Venice. The location is unbeatable- literally right next to the Accademia Gallery with it's beautiful collection of Venetian art, and the Accademia Bridge with one of those best views along the Grand Canal. My wife and I stayed in room #10, with a double bed and two windows looking right out on the Grand Canal. The room was furnished with antique furniture and had an original 300 year old painted ceiling. We greatly enjoyed having our simple but tasty breakfasts in the room each morning before setting out to explore the unique and beautiful city of Venice. The service and staff were great. We were always greeted with a smile and felt very welcomed. The complimentary mini bar in the hall stocked with cold water and soft drinks was an excellent bonus. And even the daily struggle with the finicky old locks on the door became something to look forward to. We had a very memorable stay. A big thank you to Luciano and Stefano!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Jenny84
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Hotel Galleria. After a very pleasant stay two years ago I decided to return and was not disappointed. I remembered the wonderful view of the grand canal from my room, the quirky decor and the lovely breakfast brought to my room each day ... The location of this hotel is fantastic and it is very reasonably priced for the comfort and service that is offered. On both of my stays I have taken rooms with shared bathrooms but this has caused very little inconvenience and the bathroom has always been clean. The staff are very kind and helpful and the fridge in the hallway with cold drinks is extrememly welcome during the Italian summer. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cinzian
Reviews.Content: Two steps from the Accademia Bridge, a 15-min. walk from St. Mark's. Very convenient and quiet location. Somewhat hot with no air conditioning in Aug., though a huge ceiling fan helped to give relief from the heat. We've stayed in smaller but more comfortable hotel rooms. Perhaps it was the lack of surfaces to lay things out. Breakfast is 8-9:30, so we went without as we were out each morning by 8 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Very central boutique hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: RedPandaJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Galleria for two nights, booked directly with the hotel which was no problem at all. We chose one of the cheaper rooms with a view over the Accademia Bridge, could just see the Grand Canal if we leaned out the window! It was very hot while we were there, luckily the windows opened and there was a ceiling fan. The room itself as well as the bathroom was tiny, but you have to expect that in Europe. All part of the experience! Being a converted palace, the hotel has its quirks (such as the antique doors), but we found it very convenient and easy to walk to attractions. Breakfast was included (delivered to your room at a nominated time as there is not a dining room), which was very nice. A perk that we didnt realise was included was a complimentary mini-bar. Although it is quite central, we didnt find it noisy at all. The staff were very helpful (you can leave your luggage at reception), but just be aware that the hotel is on the first floor and there is no lift. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room - but right on the grand canal”
Reviews.Author: katytudi
Reviews.Content: The location and the staff make this hotel. Our room had a big window that opened wide-behind the head of the bed - and that overlooked the grand canal. The room, however, was about the width of the bed, and the bathroom was a tiny closet. This was not a room we longed to spend time in, but when we did, it was pleasant enough, and it was nice that breakfast came to the room each morning. The staff was also very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ursula312
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice little hotel. It is clean and well kept, and the staff and proprietiors are terrific. Some rooms are small, but the views on the Grand Canal are priceless. The mini-fridge of cold drinks in the hall was most welcome on hot days. Breakfast was good and filling without being overwhelming, and it was nice to have in the room looking out the windows. It's a lovely, lovely base for exploring Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, great location”
Reviews.Author: aztravel99
Reviews.Content: We were in room #2, listed as "view on the Accademia bridge and partially on the Grand Canal", the photo attached shows our view - the stairs of the bridge, If you stuck your head out the window you saw the Grand Canal. Breakfast was standard, not fancy but good for the morning. When we checked in and asked about the view we were told we had a view of the bridge. Be sure to ask for a room on the canal, partial views are not worth the price. Overall we had a good time, room was clean, food in Venice was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view, charming room”
Reviews.Author: SojournertruthUsa
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this small hotel near the Academia Bridge. Our room (10) was spacious, nicely furnished and looked out onto the Grand Canal. Sitting by the large open windows and viewing life on the canal was one of the highlights of our stay in Venice. Service in the hotel was excellent and the location was very convenient. We hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “The smallest room in the world!”
Reviews.Author: durhamrf
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights. When I booked the room I was told in an email that it was "small". When I asked "how small" I did not get a response. That should have been a warning!! We had a "small" double room with canal view and private bath. Yes, the location is great. The view is great. However, if you stand in the middle of the room and extend your arms you can acutally touch both of the walls - that's "small"!!! No TV or internet access. For international calls there is a credit card service. Beware!! I made a call to my dad in the US and when I got the answering machine I hung up. The charge on my credit card was $39.95 and I didn't even get to talk to him! A simple breakfast was served in the room but you were asked not to sit on the bed to eat. There was no other way. Other than the bed there was 1 small chair and a dresser/closet. The bathroom was very tiny as well. It rained hard the entire time we were in Venice. Streets flooded. On our last night there was a bad odor, I guess from the flooding. We did see one of the other, larger rooms and this room looked fine. I would definitely not stay in any of their "small" rooms again!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: kzn1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located to see Venice by foot. The Vaporetto stops at the front door so no carrying of bags through the streets is necessary. It's about a 15 min walk to St Marks and about 20mins to Rialto. On the day we left there was a taxi strike. To walk back to Tronchetto would have apparently been about 20 - 25 mins stroll. Zattere which is behind the hotel had taxi's operating which we used - same cost as the Vaporetto. When we booked we were given the option of Room 4 - stunning huge room but without bathroom or Room 9 - a SMALL room with a bathroom. We decided on Room 9 as we weren't sure about sharing ablutions. We were pleasantly surprised, although it was small it wasn't as bad as we thought. There was a gap between the bed and wall (only about 30cm) to walk to the window. The bathroom was small but all we needed. I checked on the shared ablutions the next morning and found them to be clean and very nice. The view from our room was superb. The room was spotlessly clean and quiet at night. On arrival we were issued with a credit card sized fold up map which was quite detailed and really handy. Our breakfast order was taken and delivered promptly the next morning at the time requested. The hot chocolate was so thick you almost had to eat it with a spoon. We never managed to eat all the food we were given for breakfast. It was no problem to check out and leave our bags for the day. The hotel is small, cosy and well run by Luciano and Stefano who make it their business to ensure you are happy.

Reviews.Title: “I can not wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: travelwinegirl
Reviews.Content: I requested room #5. (even thought it had a shared bath - which was clean and not a problem for me). The view and atmosphere of being on the Grand Canal was priceless. The room was quite large for european standards and it had a king size bed (2 twins together). I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely go back and stay there again (my hope is soon). Location was conveiment and walkable to everything. Vaporetto stop right in front too if you want to take a boat : )

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value for money on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: goodyme
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and although the room was tiny, we were told ahead of time that this was so. Charming, clean, nice breakfast, nice staff. Two provisoes - don't expect the Hilton, and don't visit if you are not slim (unless you have one of the large rooms). The others are only large enough for the bed with a few inches to spare

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and view”
Reviews.Author: postinterrail
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the Galleria- the location was great for both walking in all directions and for the easy connection to the Vaporettos. The room (9) is barely large enough for the bed, but the bed was pretty firm. Most importantly, the view of the grand canal made for a wonderful start for the day, where we enjoyed breakfast by the window. Luciano and everyone else were very welcoming and accommodating. Other things to note: the vaporetto stop is right next door, as is a cafe with excellent coffee. Restaurant food in Venice is overpriced and mostly mediocre- we enjoyed picnics in the the great campos at a fraction of the cost. For swimmers, ask Luciano and he can help direct you to a decent pool only two vaporettos stops away, near the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: djchen1228
Reviews.Content: Hotel Galleria is a boutique hotel located right by the Accademia bridge w/ easy access to vaporetto. I stayed in a double w/ a view of the bridge. Room was spacious, clean and romantic. I loved the idea of "coming home" each night. My room (#3) had a view of the bridge but keep in mind it directly faces the base of the bridge meaning you see more of the sidewalk & tourists than the water. you have to crane your head out the window to get a view of the grand canal. however room still had the full flavor of the grand canal, no complaints. Bathroom was down the hall and always clean, abundant supply of soaps, shampoos, etc. Breakfast was simple but delightful, consisting of a delicious croissant, a roll ( a litle dry but oh well), tea or coffee, selection of spreads, cheese and yougurt. The front desk was always warm and helpful. Say hi to Albert when you visit! he's the night shift =)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View!”
Reviews.Author: sapphire11507
Reviews.Content: This is a hidden gem of a hotel! Make sure to ask for the room with the crescent shaped windows - it's their best room and probably our favorite hotel room for our whole trip. The view from the window looking out over the grand canal is fantastic. You will not regret this hotel stay. The service was friendly and prompt. The hotel is on the second floor of this building and there is a restaurant underneath. We absolutely loved the room, the decor, and even the old fashioned key to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful view, beautiful room, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: DevonTraveller14
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned this trip to celebrate our special birthdays. The Galleria was recommended by friends who had stayed there several times before (it must be good if they keep returning!). We arrived very late (just before midnight) due our plane being delayed by snow. We were given a very warm welcome, and despite the gas main being fractured and the whole area being without gas, our room had an electric heater in and it was very warm. We opened our shutters to admire the view at night: this was just stunning. Room 10 was spacious and beautifully decorated with traditional furniture. Breakfast (including delicious croissants) was served in our room, while we admired the view again. Its location next to the Accademia Bridge couldn't have been better, and all the main tourist areas are easily accessible by foot (or by vaporetto: the stop is next to the hotel). We returned to our room to be greeted by a bottle of bubbly. Luciano knew it was our birthdays! What a lovely touch, and much appreciated. It was a delightful stay. This hotel is a real gem, and highly recommended for great value.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for real Venice, don't look elsewhere !!”
Reviews.Author: walinne
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 5 day trip to Venice and we stayed at the Galleria room 8, the best room for a couple, in my opinion ! Everything said before is absolutely true, it's really a find ! Luciano greeted us when we arrived and gave us very good tips for restaurants ( Casin dei Nobili et Oniga are very close and excellent and not too expensive !). The room is exactly like on the photos and spotless clean ! We woke up very early just to see the sun coming up on Santa Maria della Salute and all the traffic on grand canal. Breakfast (juice, joghurt, warm croissants, bread, very very strong coffee ask for milk if you have a weak stomach, jam...) is served in the room so we could continue to admire the view ! We visited all day and when we came back late in the afternoon, we were always warmly welcomed by Stefano or Luciano. Staying at the Galleria is really going back in the past , living like in the eighteenth century but with all the advantages of our century. The room was very well heated, the water was always hot and no problem with the plumbing. The room was done every morning and is always very clean. If you are looking for charm, authenticiy, this is the place. If Proust was still alive, he wouldn't go to the Danieli anymore, he would come to the Galleria ! Thank you very much Luciano and Stefano, you're doing a very good job and we will surely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: ErikandSamantha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Galleria for the second time over Thanksgiving 2008 and it was even better that we'd remembered it. Our room had a private bath and a large window that opened up directly on the Grand Canal...how could you ask for anything more?! The room was small, but it's perfect for enjoying a glass of wine in front of the window at night and watching the canal traffic go by. Breakfast served in the room is great, and you can enjoy your view while you get ready for the day. The hot chocolate is to die for (and probably an entire day's calorie intake, but worth every single one!). The location can't be beat...it's a 2 minute walk from the Ali Laguna stop (literally in a straight line), 5 minutes from San Marco and directly in front of the Accademia Bridge. There are a ton of great restaurants nearby. The only complaint we had was that when we first arrived, after a 20-hour trip, my husband spoke English to the woman at the front desk. Although we are intermediate Italian speakers, it was just instinct. There was a housekeeper standing nearby who was obviously offended by us "stupid Americans" and was talking loudly under her breath about how awful we were. It would have been fine if we didn't understand what she was saying! That said, even she can't ruin this place!! It's perfect and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 36mouse
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in a great location right by the Accademia Bridge on the Grand Canal. The breakfast provided in your room is excellent (croissants, bread and cheese, yoghurt, nice strong coffee). The staff are friendly and willing to help. The only bad points: The walls are quite thin, and noise travels easily. A "room with a view" is probably a bit of an exaggeration

Reviews.Title: “Charmer on the Grend Canal”
Reviews.Author: Dmctimm
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this pleasant hotel located directly on the Grand Canal. Isnâ€™t that what Venice is all about? Open your window and there it is! Even though it was November, we were able to sleep with our window open each night and listen to the water and sounds of the city. The room was quaint and cozy â€“ quite narrow, but that is part of the charm. It did not bother us at all. Location wise, it is right by the water taxi stop and easily accessible after a boat ride from the airport. We had no trouble finding the hotel. You really can walk everywhere, which is what we did. Thatâ€™s the draw to the city so you wonâ€™t want to miss the opportunity to experience the adventure. Get used to making some wrong turns. The staff at the hotel was gracious and the breakfast served was totally European. I do want to mention that if you like to hit the sheets early and are sensitive to noise you may be bothered by the sound of the water taxis that stop right by the hotel. It did not bother us at all and we actually found it to be soothing. Bottom line, we would not hesitate to stay at Hotel Galleria again. For the cost of a room looking out on the Grand Canal, it is one heck of a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Loved This Cute Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: trickrider
Reviews.Content: We just loved this hotel! I actually made a mistake and booked the hotel for the wrong date! when we showed up they accomodated our party and since they didn't have enough rooms (my mistake) they helped the rest of our party get rooms right down the street which were nice too! Very Nice Staff that speaks English. Hotel Galleria was so cute and had some much old Italy charm. Our Window outside looking at the canal and bridge was worth it! I would stay there again and hope I can someday!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ihansen
Reviews.Content: This Hotel sits on the Grand Canel and is 75m from Accademia Bridge and very easy to find. In Venice that means something lol? Rooms are small in our case (1.7m wide) but clean and a view of the Grand Canal to die for. Very easy to get around Venice with San Marco Palazzo only 600m by boat. Stefano one of the owners put us onto a restaurant for 20 Euro all you could eat and are you ready for it...drink! Buffet style but Venice is so expensive this is great value anywhere. The hotel is one star but the location, lovely breakfast and lovely ambiance makes this hotel a must for the budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great option in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MuppetLondon
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly service and value for money. Partial views of the canal and close to all main attractions. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love Hotel Galleria!”
Reviews.Author: Wheetrvel
