Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at one of the rooms overlooking the Grand Canal for 3 nights this past September and I wholeheartedly agree with the positive reviews that this B & B has received. Excellent location, friendly staff and best value for your money! Every morning, we looked forward to the yummy croissant and cafe au lait, etc. seated by the window overlooking the canal and the Academia bridge witnessing the beginning of each day of this enchanting place called Venice. I'd like to share something that happened on our last day at this B & B. The day before checking out; I "lost" my wallet with credit cards & some cash. I reported the lost to the credit card companies, etc. (after I mentally & physically walked thru the motion of my activities prior to the realization of the missing wallet: to the extent that I even went back to the store that I last used one of my credit cards.) Literally 5 minutes before departure, we were seated by the reception desk (waiting for our private water taxi pick-up), casually chatting with Luciano - when one of the cleaning ladies went up to Luciano, hands him my wallet which she found cleaning under our bed!!! What a pleasant surprise! and oh, everything was there... Thanks to all the staff at the Galleria Hotel and especially to Luciano, who was so approachable and welcoming, making our stay in Venice even more memorable if you can imagine that!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel Galleria”
Reviews.Author: mccallum53
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 weeks in italy. Many thanks to tripadvisor for endless reviews and tips on where to stay and what to do. Hotel Galleria in Venice was a true gem. It is a Grand 500 year old building. We stayed in room #7 which is the tiniest room you can imagine-but sheer perfection all the same. It is literally the WIDTH of a double bed with about 1 foot to spare to shuffle by to the window. On arriving at the window you will understand why it was so perfect. We were directly on the Grand Canal, just beside the Accademia bridge. It was like having seats directly behind home plate in the world series! We spent a lot of time just sitting in the window (drinking wine!). The room was spotless with a private bath, comfortable bed with lovely crisp linens, antique furniture and charm galore. The breakfast was delivered to our room each morning on a silver tray and the croissants were warm. We just could not have asked for more. All this for 140 euro/night. Try to find that in north America. Who says italy is expensive. We would return to room #7 at The Hotel Galleria any time. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Care and Attention makes the Galleria first class!”
Reviews.Author: gozogeezer
Reviews.Content: Another satisfied customer at the Galleria! We have just returned after 3 nights at the hotel and what a lovely experience. What makes any place memorable is of course the building, the location and the atmosphere. The two guys that run the Galleria Luciano and Stefano are 'hands on' either one is there nearly all the time, they serve breakfast and attend to everything and it shows. Their obvious love for the place and the pride they take means that despite quite a difficult building they have just about got everything perfect. I cannot recommend the place too highly, shared a bathroom for the first time in my life (was dreading it as I am more used to 4/5 star business hotels) and it was an absolute breeze, the room was always spotless. All the staff take care and interest , one morning when the bathroom was occupied the maid ushered me into a vacant room bathroom, a small point but shows the general family attitude. If you are looking for a Holiday inn/Premier inn format, don't stay here but for something different, charming and refreshing get a canal view room and watch Venice go by. Kerry and Nora

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel like a bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: nopi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adorable! My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon for 2 nights after our cruise. The hotel is right off the Accademia bridge and very easy to find. It is in an extremely charming 17th century building that has no air conditioning, but it's location right next to the grand canal had a very nice breeze, and our room had a good ceiling fan which kept us very comfortable despite the heat and humidity in Venice in early September. The bed was very comfortable, and the staff was very friendly. The first night, they brought us a delicious freshly baked breakfast, and the second night, after learning we had to leave early in the morning to catch our flight home, they brought us a nice breakfast with our wake-up knock even though it was hours before they normally start serving breakfast. Also, it was rather affordable especially compared to other Venice hotels. I loved this hotel and would definitely stay here again next time we're in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel on Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: KnighIinCA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Galleria for two nights following a 12 day cruise. It was a wonderful ending to our trip. The hotel is on the second floor of a building right on the Grand Canal. It's small, arount 10 rooms or so, and is beautifully decorated with artwork and antiques. No smoking is allowed in the rooms, which was awesome! Our room, #1, had a view of the Academia Bridge and a small glimpse of the Canal. Other rooms had full Canal views, but were a few Euros more per night. We found Hotel Galleria to be an excellent value, clean, in a great location with a very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and was delivered to our room on a silver tray - coffee or tea, juice, cheese, rolls with butter and jam, and delicious warm criossants. Our room was not large, but plenty big for us - and had a private bathroom. It is the first room, next to the reception desk, so you can occasionally hear the phone ringing or a conversation going on. It didn't bother us. In all, we loved our stay at the Hotel Galleria and would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location on Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: skipperJOE98
Reviews.Content: Date, August 2008 Reviewer, Mature couple, UK We have just returned from our first visit to Venice, we found the Galleria Hotel convieniently located next to the Accademia Bridge on the Grand Canal. Our room No 1 faced the bridge, whilst a little on the small side, it was clean, tidy & had its own bathroom with towels & linen changed on a regular basis. Breakfast was served in our room, a perfect way to start the day, the staff were friendly & helpful offering advice & suggestions when asked The hotel is in a ideal position to explore Venice with the water bus stop seconds away. All in all a good quality hotel at a price designed not to break the budget.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BananaSlugger
Reviews.Content: What a gem of a hotel located right on the Grand Canal, with water bus service 30 seconds away, and all major sights within 15 minutes (or so) of walking or water bus. Super great value for the price! We stayed one night in a nice corner room (#5) with shared bath - never a problem - & three nights in a very small cozy room (#9) with private bath. There was some street noise (pedestrians) in #5 (and I assume same for lower numbered rooms on same side) as this is adjacent to the Accademia Bridge and the walkway is used all hours of the night, but the room was cute with a small sink and great views with two large windows on the corner. As others have noted, the other rooms with bath are much more spacious than #9. It REALLY is quite small but I loved every minute in there. The views from the window were great & I would stay in this room again if larger ones were not available. (That said - you had better like the person you are sharing the room with because there isn't a lot of free space.) I thoroughly enjoyed having my morning continental breakfast delivered to the room each morning (hot chocolate is awesome & definitely the way to go!). The front desk was extremely helpful & friendly. (For late night people - ask for a night key to gain access after hours to the main building.) I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: NBDAlberta
Reviews.Content: Hotel Galleria is about 30 feet from the Accademia bridge water bus stop and very easy to locate. It is in a great location to hit a lot of the tourist "hot spots" without having to go to far and if you get lost, the Accademia bridge is a great landmark to re-orient yourself. We stayed in room 4 which faces the Accademia bridge and the grand Canal. The room was small but had a sink and is more than fine for those who are just looking for a place to sleep in comfort. As we did not have a washroom in our room, we did have to share the common bathroom with a few other rooms and there was an occasional line up. Breakfast comes with the room and was awesome, they bring it to your room and it is a great way to begin your day in Venice. Staff was friendly and helpful, great value for your money in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Its all true... great stay!”
Reviews.Author: CreationAppreciation
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place, top location, awesome value, could have stayed there for months!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Pleasant Surprise in a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nandy68
Reviews.Content: I was searching high and low for a good hotel with the right price in Venice. I was just in Europe three years ago and was shocked to find out how much the hotel prices have gone up since then! Maybe it's the weak US Dollar that's the culprit but still, I didn't want to pay an arm and a leg for a decent place to stay for three nights. My patience paid off. I discovered Hotel Galleria in Tripadvisor. Price was very reasonable. Pictures looked good. Reviews were good too. But since I know too well never t believe everything that you read and see in pictures, then I put on a skpetical hat and brought my expectations down several notches. When I got there, it was a pleasant surprise! For one, I arrived at midnight alone, never been to Venice before, and when I got off the boat I thought to myself-- how am I going to find this hotel??? But Luciano, the owner, told me that it's right by the Accademia bridge and he was exactly right. I went in, and the place while small is tastefully done to every detail. It's an old palazzo that they converted into a 10-room hotel. I got a room with no private bath and it was the first time I did that. I was quite worried about common T&B but this one was good. It was always clean and it felt like I was the only one using it. Breakfast was served in the room, which was excellent. I had a small Venetian window that looked out partially to the Grand Canal and the Accademia bridge. It was postcard-perfect. I could people-watch as I ate (while they watched me too) and see the moving boats and gondolas. It was a great reminder every morning that I was in one of the most fabulous cities in the world. Luciano, one of the owners, was truly helpful with tips and all. I asked for a recommendation for a good last dinner in Venice in an non-touristy place and he pointed me to Restoteca Oniga in Piazza San Barnaba for authentic Venetian cuisine and I must say the restaurant did not disappoint. In fact, I recommended it to a Client who went to Venice two weeks after I left and she had the same great reviews. Luciano also gave me a tip on where to eat in Florence which was my next destination-- a place called Mario's right by the central market in Florence. Nothing fancy, just a hole in the wall eatery but my oh my their Florentine steak was to die for! Anyone who goes to Florence must go to Mario's. It's apparently famous too despite its low-profile and discreet style. All told, I was extremely satisfied with my Venice experience and my stay at the Hotel Galleria was a big part of it.

Reviews.Title: “The view of the grand hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: pbinto
Reviews.Content: The view of the Grand Canal in Venice and the location were ideal. The owners were very hospitable, and the room was spacious. We stayed in the premium room, #10, which left a lot to be desired. The bed needs to be replaced with a firmer mattress as the king bed was two saggy twin mattressed pushed together. The construction in the bathroom is very small, as expected in Europe. However, you had to open up the shower doors to sit comfortably on the toilet seat that slid to one side. The room is adjacent to the public guest bathroom and noise from the bathroom could be heard throughout the nite. Breakfast is served in the room at a specific prescheduled time, although you could leave a note on the door asking not to be disturbed at that time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: kurtztk
Reviews.Content: Wonderful budget location on the Grand Canal. It was just what we expected - clean, comfortable, and a great experience staying on the Grand Canal. Our room (No. 8) wasn't large but is one of the largest at the hotel. It had a small but very nice private bath and a nice breakfast nook overlooking the canal. The location couldn't be better. It's right next to the vaporetto stop and a convenient walk to either the San Marco tourist areas or the back canals of Dorsoduro. There is boat traffic even in the late evening / early morning hours, but it wasn't loud and, for us, provided great ambience. The staff were very helpful and friendly and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again and again. Compared to other prices I found on the Grand Canal, it is great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelEndlessly
Reviews.Content: A traditional hotel that is very clean and had a great location. With a great location however comes noise, so if you are a light sleeper or go early to bed early this may not be the hotel for you. Breakfast was nice served in the room each day. Ideal for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Little Venice Gem”
Reviews.Author: blackr14
Reviews.Content: Wonderful! Cute hotel with great view! Everyone at desk very kind, breakfast in room was great! We stayed in room 8 for 2 nights, loved the view! We would stay here again for sure if returning to Venice- great location!

Reviews.Title: “Yet another rave”
Reviews.Author: hodgki76
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little hotel, next to the Accademia Museum and the Bridge too. The bathroom was down the hall and was impeccable. Front desk were super nice and breakfast was delivered to the room. great experience. Highly reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: fitzrovians
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 4. Lots of character (decor, slopey floor, nice bed spread, breakfast in bed etc.). Not very spacious though, but it is Venice and the location is superb! Just next to Galleria Bridge Vaporetto stop on the Grand Canal. Rooms 5-10 face the Grand Canal. Some rooms share bathroom (see photo 3). Friendly enough and trouble free place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Venice for anyone with a dream and a budget”
Reviews.Author: mrwilzen
Reviews.Content: My daughter dreamed of going to Venice after a schoolmate told her about her trip there. Unlike many other Americans we were on a tight budget. We used frequent flier miles to get to Venice and only stayed for a long weekend (5 days) because that's what our budget allowed. The Galleria is the real deal! A dream! Our room was miniscule - not much bigger than the size of the full size bed. But the windows opened right on the Canal!!! It was fantastic! The owners were polite and helpful and we were centrally located. There's a little restaurant right downstairs and for about $20 or 30 US - we could have a small pizza, my daughter a coke, and I could have a glass of wine. If you dream of Venice, but have nightmares about how to afford it - this is the way to go! Prego!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a friendly owner!”
Reviews.Author: thepicnicpair
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. You could not find a hotel in Venice with a better location. Easy walking distance to all all the great shops and sights. Having breakfast served to you in your room and having the chance to eat and enjoy the spectacular view was one of the great highlights of our visit. The staff were very friendly and helpful, in particular the owner who we chatted with often. After walking around Venice for three days, we were even more convinced that we had found the perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Machaboy
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 3 nights upon recommendation by Rick Steves at 120 Euro a night, with a 5% discount if paid in cash (the preferred method of payment). All the receptionists speak good English, friendly and eager to help. They were kind enough to help us make museum reservations in Florence, our next destination. Reception is 24-hour. Entrance is right next to the pizzeria in the corner. There is a waterbus stop at Accademia, so it's quite easy to get here from St. Lucia train station. We took the Alilaguna waterbus from the airport and got off at Zattere, from where it's a 5-10 minute walk to the hotel. We stayed in room 4, a corner room with a view of the Grand Canal and the Accademia Bridge. Wooden furnitures, velvety wallpaper, and a mock fireplace give the room a classic feel. Above all, it was clean. There is a wash basin in the room, but the bathroom (very clean) is shared. Sure, the walls are thin, but that seems to be the case in Europe for one or two-star hotels. Never a problem for us since we would fall asleep quick after a day of walking. Breakfast is included and served in your room on a silver tray. It includes a piece of bread, a croissant, yogurt, a hot drink and a cold drink. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views!”
Reviews.Author: erm621
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights after a tour in Rome. The hotel was wonderful and exceeded my expectations. The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean. We stayed in room #9 for one night which was a little tight but had the larger room (room #10) for the 3 remaining nights. I would definitely recommend the larger room if you stay longer then 1-2 nights. I loved breakfast being served in the room and the views of the canal were wonderful! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a Grand Canal view and a nice budget place to stay while in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: Robin1250
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent two nights at the Hotel Galleria and would definitely recommend it (although we decided that, for us, Venice is a day trip only and probably wouldn't stay overnight again). If you are spending a few days, though, the Galleria is a terrific little hotel with a friendly, helpful staff and convenient location. We loved having breakfast delivered to our room :-)

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: oldshep
Reviews.Content: Although now October my wife and I, who are retired along with another retired couple from the UK, all stayed at this hotel for 3 nights Aug.21-23 2007 it was our first visit to Venice. My wife and I have only just returned home to NZ hence some delay in writing this report. This Hotel, which I booked primarily because of the Trip Advisor reviews did not disappoint. It met our expectations; rooms are small but that's just Venice, besides, how much time do you spend in the rooms?. Our friends had a small but adequate en-suites whereas my wife and I had to use a shared bathroom. This was no problem and it was always clean and well presented. We had breakfast in the rooms which was excellent. It was perfectly situated right alongside the Grand Canal by the Academia Bridge. The staff (owner operator) were pleasant and helpful gave good advise as as required. We don't think you will find a better Hotel at the price. All four of us agreed that if we ever return to Venice, which is more likely for our friends from England, we would almost certainly book in at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaCT
Reviews.Content: This wonderful little hotel is exactly as other reviewers have described it - charming, interesting, comfortable, extremely good value and in a wonderful location. As expected, given its location at the foot of the Accademia Bridge, it is also noisy. The cafe may not open until 7 am but the furniture moving does start at 5 am! Bring good ear plugs and a eye mask in summer so you can sleep with the windows open, otherwise it will be hot even with the celing fans. I would certainly come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice Experience”
Reviews.Author: CrazyinNovember
Reviews.Content: Small clean recently renovated quiet reasonably priced hotel on grand canal. Gondolas outside our window. Fifty feet from Vaparetto stop, but less than a ten minute walk to St Mark's square. Proprietors very helpful and recommended romantic restaurant off the beaten path. Perfect Venice experience. (Have been to Venice twice before)

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeInItaly
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful gem! We just got married and I took a job in Italy. Staying at this hotel was the start of our honeymoon and move to a new country. The staff was wonderful, the view from the room was spectacular, and the location was fantastic. I have traveled around the world and this is my favorite gem. Anyone who complains has not been outside of a chain hotel. Yes the breakfast is continental, but that is the norm in Venice! My wife and I are planning a few more stops at this hotel while in Italy! Enjoy the ambiance and great views and fantastic location! Next door to a great museum, right above Rick Steve's favorite Venetian pizzaria, and a block away from the Guggenheim Museum!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Noche73
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. Eating breakfast while looking out onto the Grand Canal was worth every penny. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The only thing negative I would say is that the walls are thin and when someone in the next room would close a door it almost felt like our door was being closed. I don't really think this is the hotel's fault. It's an old building and I think that's just what happens. I also wish it had TVs and Internet, but when you have a view of the Grand Canal, I guess you can live without that.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: orleansparish
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at the Hotel Galleria in Venice and had an absolutely wonderful experience. The hotel is in a central location, right beside the Academia bridge, and has a good view of the central canal. You are a short walk from most attractions in Dorsoduro and San Marco (and the Academia water taxi stop is less than a block away). The Hotel Galleria really outdoes itself with personal attention and customer service. Albert, a regular front desk agent, accomodated an extra person in my single room by providing another bed, sheets, and even a pillow (all hotels were full on that night). Every tourist question we had was answered in a friendly manner (unlike some other places in Italy!). The hotel, for location and staff, was very reasonably priced for Venice. You could spend much more money on a hotel in Venice, and the only noticeable difference would be air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Galleria! Great location and charm!”
Reviews.Author: jdsdelta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Galleria based on a recommendation from a friend who had stayed a year ago. We stayed in Room 8, which is a good size room (by European City standards) and has a nice view of the Grand Canal. The hotel is quaint and charming and the service is excellent. You receive breakfast in your room each morning and can request the time you would like the breakfast to arrive. We really enjoyed the hotel's location...in Dorosoduro district which is outside of the touristy areas and is a very welcome break especially in the crowded summer months. The hotel is right next to a Vaporetti stop and we found the stop very convenient as it is only one stop from San Marco square (the hotel is literally steps from the Accademia bridge). Overall, I would recommend this hotel. Oh - also, around the corner is a wonderful little trattoria that you HAVE to try! It's called Trattoria Ai Cugnai. It is very authentic and delicious!! Just to give you a bit of background, I researched hotels for months and months before booking...in every guidebook and read every review on TripAdvisor... this hotel will not dissapoint! Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great place - if only...”
Reviews.Author: hmhmhm
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong - I really, really enjoyed staying at Hotel Galleria. We were in Room 3, which faces towards the Academia Bridge (unfortunately, it had scaffolding on it the whole time were were there!). For those who are thinking of booking a room, I suspect that the rooms with numbers higher than ours have better views than ours did. We had to share a bathroom out in the corridor, which was kept very clean and was never a problem. Our room was quite large and had its own basin. As mentioned by previous reviewers, it was too noisy to keep the shutters and windows open during the night. Unfortunately, our room became really stuffy and hot, which made it difficult to get back to sleep after being woken up by the heat. This was unfortunate, because Hotel Galleria would be absolutely perfect if not for this. I would definitely return to Hotel Galleria next time I'm in Venice during the cooler months. If they install air-conditioning, I would definitely return (and happily pay extra euro) during the warmer months also! Overall, 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully located”
Reviews.Author: MmelaWestchester_NY
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, fabulous location, 50 steps from the vapporetto stop. Reservation via email pay in cash. I stayed in room 304 small but not at all cramped. Unluckily it is directly above an outdoor cafe, so you do have the noise until 10pm and then the pulling out of the tables at 5 am. The Accademia bridge is directly outside your window. So I suggest to ask for a room directly on the canal, wonderful views, just remember the views. Clean shared bathrooms too.

Reviews.Title: “Breath taking view from room #9”
Reviews.Author: lisamWashington
Reviews.Content: The best view in all Venice. When my husband and I arrived we were inially in a different room with not the best view, however when we were moved to room #9 it took our breath away. Affordable Excelence. Don't mind the slanted floor or the furniture arangement, just swing open the shutters to view the Grand Canal. The complimentary warm marmalade filled croissants in the morning are the best! Great location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing dependence”
Reviews.Author: heiranig
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Galleria Hotel for 2 nights during Carnavale weekend. Unfortunately we were put in their dependence which is located about a block away and has not much to do with the descriptions we read on Trip Advisor, which had made us choose this hotel. The dependence has 2 apartments which share the same entrance. Our room was a studio of good size: it was very basic, no view, thin walls (we could hear the neighbors come in and out and talk) but it was clean. This said, for the price we paid, we couldn't complain and the main hotel does looks cute, the location is good and the staff friendly. In previous visits we stayed at the Bauer (5 stars) and Ala (3 stars): both were better experiences but we still have to find our 'refuge' in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Galleria is the only place for me.”
Reviews.Author: TheLazyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel galleria is not only my favorite place to stay in Venice it is one my favorite places to stay in all of Italy. It is a small hotel (only 10 rooms) no more than 10 feet away from the Grand Canal and right at the base of the Accademia Bridge. If your going to be out of your room from the time you awake until the time you go to sleep then it won't matter where you stay, but if you want a room with a view in a nice hotel that want cost you a king's ransom then Hotel Galleria is the place. For my money there is no better view in Venice at any price. Rooms 5 -- 10 face the Grand Canal, rooms 7-- 10 have private baths. The first time I stayed there was in 1991 and my wife and I have returned 22 times. we are headed back in May for our 24th visit and bringing relatives with us. The earlier you book the better chance you have of getting a room. Have a great trip where ever you go, Rick Larkin

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: mrod1026
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Galleria in October. The staff was wonderful, clean rooms and bathroom, not to mention the excellent localtion. It is close to everything: vaporetto stops, San Marco, everything. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelling*fan
Reviews.Content: weÂ´ve stayed on Hotel galleria in December after a hard search over the internet.. Everything was booked.. well at least at reasonable prices.. This was an exception. We stayed for 3 nights and although we had to share the bathroom with other 8.. rooms.. (sounds quite scary) everything went very well! The bathroom was always very clean, the room was confortable, warm, and was exactly what we expected, a nice room in the city center with a view to the canal! The staff was also very nice and help us several times. The breakfast was served in the room at the exact time we wanted to.. (well untill 10am) and had milk, and tea, croissants, yogurt, bread.. it was really perfect. I would defenitly go there again..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: annlyn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Galleria for 3 nights in March 2006, and had a lovely experience. The highlights are the great canal views and the delicious continental breakfast delivered to your room each morning with the best hot chocolate I've had-very romantic and included in the reasonable rate! One caution, we stayed in Room 1, right next to the bell desk, and could hear every conversation. However, when we mentioned it to the staff, they clearly made an effort to have people keep their voices down. Would recommend for anyone looking for a comfortable, welcoming, and affordable room with a great location within easy walking distance of all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Hotel Galleria, Venice”
Reviews.Author: Welsh2
Reviews.Content: We had a nightmare journey to Venice, losing our luggage for four days. The staff in this hotel were so helpful, sympathizing with our plight and helping us phone. Thanks particularly to Francesca who spoke, in Italian, to the airport. And what could be better than breakfast in your room alongside the Grand Canal watching the daily traffic? This place is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in October!”
Reviews.Author: 2Weavers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this very pleasent hotel for two nights in early October. The location could not be better and the staff were very friendly. This first night we were in a room without a bathroom (which was down the hall), the room was still very, very nice and had a great view of the Accadamia bridge. The breakfast being included with the room was also a nice touch. The second night we had a huge room with a bathroom which was gorgeous. I highly recommend this hotel for being at a great location not too far from St. Marc Square as well as the pleasent staff and nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Galleria- Great Location, Price and Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Tmanstan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 days in Venice and Hotel Galleria. It was the best accomodations we had during our 2 week stay in Italy. At the foot of the Accademia Bridge along with a Vaporetto stop. Reserved a room with a view of the Grand Canal and was not disappointed! They ask when you would like your breakfast delivered to your room, very unusual in Italy. You can walk to nearly everything and when you get off the Vaporetto it is only a 1 minute walk to their door! Yes, we shared a bathroom down the hallway (unusual in the US) but, it was never a problem. Their is also a restaurant right out front that has very good food at inexpensive prices. When in Venezia, get a 24 hr. ticket for the vaporetti, they will take you about everywhere and you can use it all you want. Go to Murano! Beautiful scenery and unusual pieces of glass at very low prices! If we go back, we will stay at Hotel Galleria!

Reviews.Title: “Go to Galleria”
Reviews.Author: AcornMajor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Galleria for four nights at the completion of a two week cruise. The Hotel was so easy to get to by vaporetto from the cruise port and after alighting at Accademia, it was an easy two minute walk to the front door, a definite plus with all the luggage we took on our cruise! We booked our room in February, 2006 to ensure a good room selection at a reasonable price - a room overlooking the Grand Canal was a "must" and we were not disappointed with the view although the room (#7) appears to have been the smallest. Staff and owners Stefano and Luciano were pleasant and helpful in all matters and the "scant Venetian breakfast" to quote Rick Steeves, was on time and had great coffee. The noise was not really a problem after the first night and consisted mainly of vaporettos coming and going at the very nearby Accademia stop - I think it gave a kick to some riders to see us drinking wine and eating cheese and olives on our windowsill! The main reason to go to Galleria however, is its location away from the hurly burly of the San Marco tourist areas. My wife and I simply "got lost" in the Dorsoduro area and used it as a base for walking tours of other areas of Venice. Small bars and excellent restaurants abound in the area although the Accademia Bar Foscarini was not one of them as we had lunch-time pizzas which were burnt and contained canned mushrooms! The added plus was that it was but a short ten minute walk to the Zattere Alilaguna stop on the Giudecca Canal where we left for the airport. All in all, a good choice and an ideal location at which to decompress after a busy cruise and explore Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Deal on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Todd_Gundlach
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Galleria for two night in late September 2006 and were extremely satisfied with the decision - DO NOT LISTEN TO, OR LET YOUR DECISION BE SWAYED BY COMPLAINTS ABOUT NOISE. We booked the room well in advance after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and other similar sites. We booked room #10 and could not have been more pleased. It is a huge room with two large windows which open right on the canal. You cannot get any closer to the canal or the Academia Bridge. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room, mostly to sleep and shower and change clothes throughout the days. We were glad to have the largest room in the place, but felt it would have been completely acceptable to have either room 8 or 9, as they seemed large enough for our needs, yet I think only have one window in each room. We were able to check our bags early (10 AM), but our room was being readied so we couldn't 'check in' which was no big deal, we were anxious to check out the neighborhood, which we did, then about 11:30AM decided to head back to the hotel area (literally the foot of the Academia Bridge) and have lunch at the pizzeria next door also against the canal and on the first floor of the building that the hotel is in (the hotel consumes the 2nd floor of the buidling with a private residence on the 3rd and fourth - typical venetian). The food at the pizzeria was decent, and like everything else in Venice a little expensive - but you must know if you are going to Venice it will be a little expensive. They didn't charge for a table (per person at some restaurants like 1 or 2 euros) or add any service charge (again like some other restaurants - typically 10%); it was included in the price of their food (~7-10 euro per pizza and drinks at ~3-4 euro). The two breakfasts we had were adequate and typical european, and served when you asked for it and on lovely pewter settings. Dorsoruduro is an excellent locaiton in Venice and you won't be dissapointed for not staying in San Marco or any other area in Venice. Rialto market is only 10-15 minutes walk away (depending on how long it takes you to make it past all the shops). Right down the closest street towards the Peggy Guggeheim is the tronchetto to the area nearest St. Mark's square; the Zatterre on the Guidiecca Canal is literally right down the street with Nico's (ice cream) and La Pescina - a great seafood restaurant (which is at the John Ruskin House and La Calcina Hotel, which is also highly reccommended on this site and which I contacted as an alternative to Galleria - which when all booked up actually gave me a discount at the restaurant for contacting them - 11%. The hotel is in the best location, one of the few hotels within 20-25 steps of a valperetto stop, which should be extremely attactive to anyone with even one or more bags, as nothing was more sad than seeing tourists schleeping their bags up and down the canal bridges, trying navigating the tough streets of Venice in search of their hotel. The staff is equally awesome at Hotel Galleria. The desk is staffed around the clock and you have to ring to get the door opened, very safe. We were recommended restaurants and sites by the staff, etc. There is a cool little bar as you head towards the Guggenheim called the Corner Bar with three stools that sit on the sidewalk. Good beer and coca-cola on tap - a locals place and really neat to sit outside for a beer or two. Don't think twice about reserving a room at the Hotel Galleria - you won't be dissapointed and you will be equally pleased with your decision to not spend $200-300 more per night at a place that doesn't come close to the ammenities that this place has.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Leimen
Reviews.Content: We loved. The view, the location, the staff. Can't recommend it enought!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: K_Clark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for five nights in early August 2006. It's in a great location for the Accademia Bridge and bus stop. Most of the main attractions are within walking distance. We stayed in Room 10, which is regarded as the best room in the hotel. It had a fan to make up for the lack of air conditioning. The room was very well presented and clean and had a stunning view of the Grand Canal and Accademia Bridge, which most people would have paid good money to sit in a cafe for. The hotel staff were very welcoming and helpful. The only downside of the room was that it was next to the communal bathroom so there was some noise late at night and the shower would occasionally change in temperature without warning. There was work going on to the exterior of both buildings adjoining the hotel. This wasn't a major problem as it was carried out using hand tools.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: paws55
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 1 - it has a direct view of the Accademia Bridge and partial Grand Canal view. The staff were really helpful and having breakfast delivered into the room and having it looking at the bridge and canal is quite something. Fabulous location - good clean accommodation and very good value. Note: in May there was construction taking place nearby but hotel will be even better when the repaving etc is finished

Reviews.Title: “Galleria a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on May 11 2006 in one of the rooms (8 or 10, I don't recalll which) which is considered one of the bigger rooms with a view of the canal. Although the room is a good size, be aware that construction is going on right outside the windows that open onto the canal. The double paned windows do a good job of shutting noise out, but the construction is not the view we wanted. also, in 2 wks of touring Italy, this was one of the softer mattresses we encountered. Breakfast is brought to your room, which is a nice touch. The location is very close to the Guggenheim, and for the price, it's ok. The owners are very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Venice for a good price.”
Reviews.Author: tiggerlovesitaly
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Galleria for second time in May 2006. The first was in October 2004. Great service, excellent price for location on Grand Canal. Luciano and Stefano and their staff are top notch-helpful, friendly, and make you feel welcome in Venice. My first visit, I left my wedding ring in the room by mistake. In a panic I returned to my room to find it carefully placed on the bathroom counter. Had that happened in the USA, I doubt I would still have my ring! I will always stay here as long as Luciano & Stefano run Hotel Galleria!

Reviews.Title: “Location, View and Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Zanzibar Susie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day trip to Venice (Easter 2006) and think the Galleria is great value for money. Yes, small rooms but they're long and skinny so you still have a decent amount of space, just not quite in the places you'd like it! Sitting out on our window ledge, feet dangling over the Grand Canal, eating bread and olives and drinking Prosecco - I feel sure half the people on the passing vaporettos were wishing they had our room! It's in an ideal spot if you want to explore both the typical tourist sites and sample some Venetian local favourites. And the map they gave us in the room was better than any of the ones in the guidebooks we brought. As for the noise from the boats, well...it's part of the territory in this city really but we found if we really couldn't sleep we could close the shutters, keep the window ajar and use the ceiling fan for ventilation, no worries. On the whole a perfect hotel for a romantic getaway - would definitely recommend to friends. On a practical note, getting there from the airport is easy. We took the 11 Euro Alilaguna boat, takes about an hour and 10 minutes and you get a great view of the islands, get off at the last stop - Zattare, then walk straight through to the Accademia bridge, the hotel is on your right. Boats back to the airport leave at around half past the hour - the guys on the desk were very helpful about this, as they were with looking after our bags all day til our late flight on the last day.

Reviews.Title: “Indeed the view is "Grand" but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The view of the Grand Canal from our window was amazing! The quintessential view of Venice! I doubt there's another hotel in Venice with this view, at the rates you'll find here. Our room was miniscule, but I could live with that. The one problem we had was the noise from the vaporettos (water taxis) all night. They were right under our window. I'm not a light sleeper but I was up half the night. Maybe rooms on a higher floor would be a better choice. Other than that, the location is great - just steps from the Accademia bridge, museums and restaruants. On a previous trip to Venice, we stayed in a hotel located on one of the many small canals. The view there was lovely and it was very peacuful. If we were to go back, we'd stay in this sort of place rather than the Galleria.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view of the grand canal”
Reviews.Author: hoodlumsaint
Reviews.Content: Many people may find the room small by American standards, but it made up in charm and elegance. It was a single room with a twin bed. The bathroom is on the same floor and very clean and charming with a carved wood mirror above the sink. There is no bathtube. If you come from a big family, lived in a dorm or had a roommate it will not disturb you. Most of the time people are going to the restroom or shower at different times so it isn't such a big inconvience. Breakfast is serviced between 8am to 930am. It is a contential breakfast, but very generous. You get a pot of coffee, good size glass of orange juice, yogurt, baked on location hard roll and crossiant stuffed with apricot jam. That is not all, there are rusk type slices, wedge of cheese, jams- apricot & strawberry and butter. It is all delivered to your room at the hour you specify. It is just to the right of the Accademia Bridge and Gallery. You have less than 1/2 a block to the vaporetta stop. The view across is a lovely old palace that is painted white and yellow that is now a museum. Just to that building's right is another old palace that once housed, Monet, Whistler and where Henry James finised "Wings of a Dove". If that is not enough, the Peggy Guggenheim Museum is just a block's walk away. The area is surrounded by small boutique like shops, as well as a shoe store that sells fusilli and a expresso-pasterria. The staff goes out of their way for you. You couldn't ask for more. Oh, yeah I had a crystal scone, amoire for my clothes and a lovely chair and writing desk. I miss my room #6 already.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal on Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: kcinders
Reviews.Content: If you want to be on the Grand Canal in Venice the Hotel Galleria is a good deal (we paid 120Euros/night). It is right near the Accademia bridge so it's close to the touristy areas without being overrun. Rooms are long & narrow and the bathrooms can be quite small but it has recently been renovated, is clean, and quiet too. They serve a good breakfast to your room. I don't think they have air-con so it could get noisy in summer if you have to leave the window open. Be aware that not all the rooms have a private bath or look directly on to the canal.

Reviews.Title: “tiny room - stunning location”
Reviews.Author: mandleberry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Galleria in late October for 3 nights. Our room was tiny - it was hilarious watching my husband reverse down the room with the breakfast tray until he passed the en-suite bathroom - only then was there enough space to turn around! But it was clean and comfortable, and the view of the Grand Canal was second to none. It is ideally situated - convenient for everything we wanted to do - and there are some nice restaurants nearby, and a wonderful little bar on the Fondamente Nani round the corner. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful olde-worlde charm!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed five nights at the Hotel Galleria; had a beautiful, spacious corner room overlooking the Grand Canal. The breakfasts were large and delicious - made moreso by the wonderful view! Like staying in a 'Merchant-Ivory' film, but will all the modern conveniences, and warm friendly staff. We will go again!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Galleria
HotelInfo.Address: Dorsoduro 878 / A | Accademia Bridge, 30132 Venice, Italy
